After that, unpack the distribution. You need to make sure $DIST/perl/site is in the mod_perl include path. Next create an alias for $DIST/perl/site/cgi, and make sure all files except for those ending with .css are handled by mod_perl.

section.title: Configuring Config.pm
section.para: At the beginning of the file $DIST/perl/site/Technion/Seminars/Config.pm are several constants that need to be set. Search for SET ME and set them to their apporpriate values.

section.title: Initializing the Database
section.para: Create a MySQL database that the user specified in Config.pm have full read and write permissions to. Fill the database using $DIST/site/sql/create_tables.sql. This will create a default super-user named root with password root.

section.title: Logging to the Web Interface
section.para: Access the site's URL and access the admin link. Log in as root, with password root. (make sure you change the password afterwards). Now, you can start adding clubs and users and set up the system.
